__e: YOU'RE YOUNG AND NAIVE AND, AND ALL THOSE DREAMS YOU HAVE ABOUT GETTING OUT OF THIS TOWN AND BECOMING SOMETHING STILL SEEM REACHABLE.
It was Grace who told me how naive I was and that... all it meant was that shit happens.
I don't know who you are, but I know better than to cross him.

But the man I married, the man I had a child with, he was foolish enough to think he lived in a world where... where the vice President of the United States shouldn't be able to murder her husband in cold blood and get away with it. Silly.
I'm not naive enough to think that you'll be able to understand what I'm about to say is a compliment, but... This is all yours.
Because it's either that or you're completely oblivious, - and I'm pretty sure you're not that stupid.
Hey, you know what? You can think it's lame, but it's a big deal. It's... it's a weird big deal.
And I know that this may sound naive, but I feel like with enough time we can do anything.
